foundation.content: Flux Signal is designed to catch trend changes early, giving traders an edge by entering positions before the majority of market participants recognize the shift. The strategy combines proprietary signal generation with traditional technical analysis principles.
foundation.heading: The Foundation of Flux Signal

howItIdentifies.heading: How It Identifies Opportunities
howItIdentifies.intro: The strategy monitors multiple market factors simultaneously:

earlyReversal.label: Early Reversal Signals:
earlyReversal.text: Detects potential trend reversals before they become obvious

continuation.label: Continuation Patterns:
continuation.text: Identifies when trends are likely to continue rather than reverse

momentum.label: Momentum Shifts:
momentum.text: Captures changes in market momentum that precede price movements

volume.label: Volume Confirmation:
volume.text: Uses volume analysis to validate signal strength

entryCriteria.heading: Entry Criteria
entryCriteria.intro: Flux Signal doesn't rely on a single indicator. Instead, it requires multiple conditions to align:
points: Proprietary signal indicator must show a clear signal
Price action must confirm the signal direction
Risk-reward ratio must meet minimum thresholds

earlyDetection.content: Getting into trades early means better entry prices and improved risk-reward ratios. Flux Signal's ability to identify opportunities before they become obvious gives traders a significant advantage, especially in fast-moving markets where late entries can result in poor risk-reward setups.
